p: For the production of single cell oil, C. curvatus ATCC 20509 was used. Cultivation was conducted as outlined by Dillschneider et al. ( 2014). Briefly, the culture medium was based on a phosphate buffer pH 5 (8.99 g/L KH 2PO 4 and 0.12 g/L Na 2HPO 4 · 2 H 2O). The medium constituents were 0.1 g/L sodium citrate (C 6H 5O 7Na 3 · 2 H 2O), 0.1 g/L yeast extract, 0.2 g/L MgSO 4 · 7 H 2O and 4.72 g/L (NH 4) 2SO 4. Medium was supplemented with 2 mL trace elements solution (4 g/L CaCl 2 · 2 H 2O, 0.55 g/L FeSO 4 · 7 H 2O, 0.475 g/L citric acid, 0.1 g/L ZnSO 4 · 7 H 2O, 0.076 g/L MnSO 4 · H 2O, 100 μL18 M H 2SO 4) and 1 mL salt solution (20 g/L MgSO 4 · 7 H 2O, 10 g/L yeast extract) per 100 mL cultivation medium. During cultivation, salts and trace elements were added once every 24 h to the culture broth. Unpurified cellulose fiber hydrolysate was used as carbon source. The hydrolysate was diluted with distilled water to obtain a stock solution with a concentration of 500 g/L carbohydrates. The initial sugar concentration in the culture medium was 50 g/L. Stock solution was fed daily to keep sugar concentration constant between 50 and 90 g/L during the whole cultivation.
